name: places/ChIJt9gnj1ZZwokRyqAoWPIIQLA
adrFormatAddress: 126 2nd Ave, New York, NY 10003, USA

originalText.text:
I experienced a thrilling night at Rachel Bloom’s show at the Orpheum yesterday!
It was a sold out show and the theater packed , a PERFECT venue for her artistry!

I don’t think I had been to the Orpheum since the Stomp days and was delighted to see it’s still
Up and running with that same vibe!

The seats all offer a great view of the stage and the ushers and box office are convivial!

I will keep in touch about upcoming projects!

I think anyone dissing this theater is not realizing it is a long standing OFF BROADWAY theater in updated good shape!

Ps the bathrooms upstairs are clean and well appointed !

originalText.text: My mum and I saw Rachel Bloom's show and it was such a delight! The show was warm, funny, and surprising! Felt like you spent the last couple years with her. The staff at the theater was wonderful! Highly recommend! Go for a hot chocolate at Roasted NYC before the show.

text.text: My mum and I saw Rachel Bloom's show and it was such a delight! The show was warm, funny, and surprising! Felt like you spent the last couple years with her. The staff at the theater was wonderful! Highly recommend! Go for a hot chocolate at Roasted NYC before the show.

originalText.text: Very good no-nonsense theater. The A/C was very good and the ushers were professional and at the same time friendly- major props to one usher for making people with "Will Call" tickets go back in the line and not jump everyone else with advance tickets. Only criticism is seats are a bit small. Also I don't know if there's a water fountain or not- I didn't see one in my visit but possible there is one. Bathroom also cramped and could be cleaner.

text.text: Very good no-nonsense theater. The A/C was very good and the ushers were professional and at the same time friendly- major props to one usher for making people with "Will Call" tickets go back in the line and not jump everyone else with advance tickets. Only criticism is seats are a bit small. Also I don't know if there's a water fountain or not- I didn't see one in my visit but possible there is one. Bathroom also cramped and could be cleaner.

originalText.text: Small long theater, but the AC was fantastic and for shows with a smaller crowd it had a much more intimate feel and I enjoyed the show I saw here a lot!

text.text: Small long theater, but the AC was fantastic and for shows with a smaller crowd it had a much more intimate feel and I enjoyed the show I saw here a lot!

originalText.text: Our experience at the Orpheum theater was an absolute blast, thanks primarily to the riveting performance of the “Empire Strips Back” cabaret Star Wars parody. This show was an incredible spectacle, combining humor, creativity, and a distinctive twist on the beloved franchise that left us thoroughly entertained. The vibrancy of the performance transformed an otherwise ordinary theater visit into an unforgettable night out. While the Orpheum itself may not stand out as unique, the quality of the shows it hosts certainly shines. The superb experience of the "Empire Strips Back" warrants a full five-star rating for Orpheus theater, demonstrating that sometimes, the magic is in the performance rather than the venue.
